column3:
Imo we should remove these icons from the Readme, since they serve no purpose.

Locally you can check the build status by typing `make check` and run the functional tests.
And for any commit on GitHub, the build status is shown as a tiny icon right next to the commit date of that commit.

If we really wanted to keep them, we'd have to update them on every major version branch-off. Not re

besides that, even if we want to add this to the README.md at some point I'd prefer to wait a while to see if we get appveyor to be stable and useful in the first place\nright now, it's failing *again*\n
Closing for now, waiting for it to be stable.
